title: Bug 113047: No children nodes listed when changing data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the query tab's data set editor page, no children nodes are listed.
EB: The expected result is that when changing the data source, the children nodes of the new data source should be listed.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. In the data set editor, go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source. Actual result: The new data source does not list any database, table, or column information. Close the data set editor and reopen it.
